intro: Coccothrinax crinita subsp. crinita, commonly known as the royal palm, is a member of the Arecaceae family and is native to the Caribbean. It is a tall, slender palm with a single trunk and feather-like leaves that give it a graceful appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into clustered, fibrous fruits. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions. Its resilience and aesthetic value have made it a symbol of the Caribbean landscape.
